[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Interop: Pairing engine] When converting to Scalar<E>, can different pairing engine implementations (BLS12-381 vs BLS12-377) cause type mismatches or security weaknesses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Interop: External crates] Can vulnerabilities in dependencies (aptos-crypto, ark-ec, etc.) be exploited through InputSecret's API surface? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Interop: FFI boundaries] If InputSecret crosses FFI boundaries (to C/C++ code), can marshaling errors or type confusion introduce vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Logging: SilentDebug bypass] Can error types containing InputSecret accidentally log secrets through nested Debug implementations that don't respect SilentDebug? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Logging: Panic messages] Can panic messages from operations on InputSecret leak partial secret information through stack traces or error messages? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Logging: Telemetry] Can telemetry or metrics collection accidentally capture InputSecret values or derive information about secrets from operation counts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Audit: Provenance tracking] Can InputSecret values be traced back to their generating validators, breaking anonymity properties required for some DKG applications? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Audit: Timing logs] Can detailed timing logs of InputSecret operations be analyzed to reverse-engineer secret values through statistical analysis? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Attack: Related-key attacks] Can attackers force relationships between different validators' InputSecrets, enabling related-key attacks on the derived shared key? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Attack: Weak randomness] Can weak or predictable randomness during InputSecret generation allow attackers to brute-force or predict validator secrets? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Attack: Rogue-key attacks] Can a malicious validator choose their InputSecret based on honest validators' public keys to compromise the aggregated shared key? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Attack: Grinding attacks] Can validators repeatedly generate InputSecrets until finding one with exploitable properties, then use it in the DKG protocol? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Attack: Adaptive attacks] Can attackers adaptively choose InputSecrets based on previous DKG rounds, gradually weakening the security of the shared key? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/input_secret.rs] [Quantum: Shor's algorithm] Are the field sizes used in InputSecret large enough to resist quantum attacks via Shor's algorithm on discrete logarithm problems? (Critical)
